picks.text: Siri on iOS will gain more verbal responses, speak more than it does now when activated with your voice
picks.full-pick-text: Siri on iOS will gain more verbal responses, speak more than it does now when activated with your voice
picks.notes:
• "It can hold longer conversations without the user needing to look at the screen."
  • This was graded as a half point or a "kinda".

picks.text: The iPhone 7S and 7S+ will look like the 7 and 7+, not this edge to edge unicorn phone that has been rumored
picks.full-pick-text: The iPhone 7S and 7S+ will look like the 7 and 7+, not this edge to edge unicorn phone that has been rumored
picks.notes:
• This was deemed correct during grading, allowing for the "7S" actually being named the 8.
  • During grading, Myke wondered if Stephen had been thinking that there would be a phone with the traditional design, or if he was thinking that there would be no "unicorn" phone at all. Of course, it is impossible to read his mind, but in the original pick, Stephen seems to imply that it will just be the "7S".

picks.text: 2017 will see a more powerful iMac at the top of the line that rivals and replaces the Mac Pro
picks.full-pick-text: 2017 will see a more powerful iMac at the top of the line that rivals and replaces the Mac Pro. The Mac Pro will go away, the Mac Mini also goes away, by the end of 2017 the iMac is all that remains.
picks.notes:
• "The Mac Pro will go away, the Mac Mini also goes away, by the end of 2017 the iMac is all that remains."
  • While explaining, Myke got a little carried away with how complete this transition would be, but when challenged to make it part of the pick, he decided to go for it.

picks.text: iCloud free 5 GB limit will be increased
picks.full-pick-text: iCloud free 5 GB limit will be increased

picks.text: An iPhone Pro with Apple Pencil support, 2 Apple Pencils
picks.full-pick-text: An iPhone Pro with Apple Pencil support, 2 Apple Pencils
picks.notes:
• "2 Apple Pencils: the standard and a short one that supports the iPhone and iPad mini"
  • During grading, Federico proposes what will become Risky Picks, including 2 points for correct picks and losing a point for being wrong, as Myke describes how he wanted to go big with this pick.

picks.text: Apple Music will be redesigned again
picks.full-pick-text: Apple Music will be redesigned again
picks.notes:
• "Will gain more Spotify-like algorithmic features"
  • "An Apple version of the Daily Mix and a way to discover back catalog songs from artists you don't know (Discover Weekly?)"
  • The New Music Daily feature would eventually come in 2019.

picks.text: Some element of an AR focused device from Apple
picks.full-pick-text: Some element of an AR focused device from Apple
picks.notes: • The iPhone X and ARKit is deemed to fulfill this

picks.text: An executive shakeup in the iOS or Mac OS software teams
picks.full-pick-text: An executive shakeup in the iOS or Mac OS software teams

picks.text: Redesigned Mac Pro
picks.full-pick-text: Redesigned Mac Pro

picks.text: A 10.9" bezel-less iPad Pro
picks.full-pick-text: A 10.9" bezel-less iPad Pro

picks.text: iOS 10.3 with a redesigned split screen revealing the home screen and the app switcher instead of the vertical slider we have now
picks.full-pick-text: iOS 10.3 with a redesigned split screen revealing the home screen and the app switcher instead of the vertical slider we have now
picks.notes: • Two iPad multitasking refreshes later, a version that shows the home screen finally arrived in iPadOS 15.

picks.text: Multi-user on iPad support for the masses
picks.full-pick-text: Multi-user on iPad support for the masses

picks.text: New iPad accessories: Keyboard + protection + pencil holder
picks.full-pick-text: New iPad accessories: Keyboard + protection + pencil holder

relevant-episodes.title: Connected #174: 2017 In Review: I've Been Sitting on That Joke for Months

picks.text: The Mac Pro will ship by the end of 2018
picks.full-pick-text: The Mac Pro will ship by the end of 2018
picks.notes: • Later in 2018, Apple dashed Stephen's hopes of getting this correct. As promised, the Mac Pro came out in 2019.

picks.text: There will be a bigger iPhone X style phone, but it will not have an OLED screen
picks.full-pick-text: There will be a bigger iPhone X style phone, but it will not have an OLED screen
picks.notes: • The iPhone XR saved Myke here, as the XS Max was OLED which he didn’t think would be possible for such a big display.

picks.text: iOS 12 will have a focus on "faster", speed and performance optimizations being a tentpole feature
picks.full-pick-text: iOS 12 will have a focus on "faster", speed and performance optimizations being a tentpole feature
picks.notes:
• "It will be on a slide."
  • Ungraded examples: "faster animations, maybe 64-bit, Swift, Pro Motion, something under the scenes, maybe a built-in cache cleanup feature"

picks.text: Apple Watch with an always-on display
picks.full-pick-text: Apple Watch with an always-on display
picks.notes: • The Series 5 watch added this feature in 2019.

picks.text: A streaming service announced as Apple Video
picks.full-pick-text: A streaming service announced as Apple Video. 1-2 months for free, bundled with Apple Music as an option
picks.notes: • "1-2 months for free, bundled with Apple Music as an option"

picks.text: No new iPad mini
picks.full-pick-text: No new iPad mini
picks.notes: • "(if it's killed, I'm not wrong)"

picks.text: Workflow 2 will appear as a system feature or app
picks.full-pick-text: Workflow 2 will appear as a system feature or app
picks.notes:
• "Heavy on Siri integration, framework for pro apps to talk to each other"
  • Ungraded: probably a migration tool from version 1, the App Store version might be kept around for a while
  • Some contention during grading about pro apps talking to each other leads to clarification that the entire pick must be true, but this one is deemed close enough.

picks.text: iTunes rewrite or replacement for Mac OS
picks.full-pick-text: iTunes rewrite or replacement for Mac OS
picks.notes: • iTunes was eventually split up in 2019.

picks.text: iOS 12 features a large scale UI redesign across iOS, the biggest since iOS 7
picks.full-pick-text: iOS 12 features a large scale UI redesign across iOS, the biggest since iOS 7

picks.text: Reminders will get a major redesign modeled after iOS 11 and Files
picks.full-pick-text: Reminders will get a major redesign modeled after iOS 11 and Files
picks.notes:
• "With new family sharing features and integration with the HomePod."
  • The redesign of Reminders did come eventually in 2019, with many more new features in 2021.

picks.text: AppKit and UIKit give birth to something new and cross-platform
picks.full-pick-text: AppKit and UIKit give birth to something new and cross-platform
picks.notes: • SwiftUI was announced in 2019.

picks.text: A new Apple Pencil with a button of some kind
picks.full-pick-text: A new Apple Pencil with a button of some kind
picks.notes: • "(aluminum?)"

picks.text: A new smart keyboard: new material, backlit keys, a dedicated Siri key
picks.full-pick-text: A new smart keyboard: new material, backlit keys, a dedicated Siri key
picks.notes: • Apple's Magic Keyboard basically matching this description came out in 2020.

picks.text: iPod Touch updated
picks.full-pick-text: iPod Touch updated
picks.notes: • The 7th generation update finally came in 2019.

picks.text: On iOS 12, the home screen features more than just app icons
picks.full-pick-text: On iOS 12, the home screen features more than just app icons
picks.notes: • WIdgets would finally be added to the home screen in iOS 14.

picks.text: Apple Video and Apple Music have dedicated apps for Mac and iOS
picks.full-pick-text: Apple Video and Apple Music have dedicated apps for Mac and iOS
picks.notes:
• "Music and Video removed from iTunes on the Mac"
  • iTunes was eventually split up in 2019.

relevant-episodes.title: Connected #175: The Devil on my Shoulder
Connected #208: It’s Ugly and I Want It
Connected #224: 2018 in Review: The Wonder of Everything

picks.text: There will be a new Apple news subscription service for content from select publications
picks.full-pick-text: There will be a new Apple news subscription service for content from select publications

picks.text: The Mac Pro will ship (in 2019 this time)
picks.full-pick-text: The Mac Pro will ship (in 2019 this time)
picks.notes:
• Added mid-year: Must be able to order a Mac Pro by the end of 2019, they do not have to arrive in customer hands by the end of the year.
  • Ungraded: "I waffle on sticking with my iMac Pro"; he bought one almost immediately. Myke predicted that Stephen would buy a Mac Pro, exchange it for an iMac Pro, then buy another Mac Pro in 6 months.

picks.text: Apple will launch a subscription service featuring original video content
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will launch a subscription service featuring original video content

picks.text: iOS gets a tabbed windows feature that all apps can implement
picks.full-pick-text: iOS gets a tabbed windows feature that all apps can implement
picks.notes: • "Tabbed windows" was acknowledged as an unclear phrase, and was intended to convey that one app could show two separate documents or views, similar to Safari's special side by side mode at the time.

picks.text: The MacBook Escape will go away
picks.full-pick-text: The MacBook Escape will go away

picks.text: On iOS 13, the iPad home screen features more than just app icons
picks.full-pick-text: On iOS 13, the iPad home screen features more than just app icons

picks.text: Reminders gets a major update
picks.full-pick-text: Reminders gets a major update
picks.notes:
• "(how do we decide major? — on stage at WWDC or we decide past that)"
  • Ungraded: "some features that Federico would like to see", the actual features that Federico talked about were not recorded in the document, but were: a new, more flexible design, easier and faster to add dates and notes, tags, saved searches, better Files integration

picks.text: First ARM Mac ships
picks.full-pick-text: First ARM Mac ships
picks.notes: • Halfway through the year, Myke ups the ante: "If Stephen gets this right, I will buy you one, if the Mac Pro is an ARM Mac I will buy you the top of the line model."

picks.text: Apple releases an iPhone subscription service that bundles a device, AppleCare, and a selection of other Apple content services into one monthly payment
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases an iPhone subscription service that bundles a device, AppleCare, and a selection of other Apple content services into one monthly payment
picks.notes:
• "(Not just additional iCloud space)"
  • The free AppleTV+ trial with new devices combined with an iPhone Upgrade Program purchase is deemed to not count during grading.

picks.text: AirPower is released and new AirPods are released
picks.full-pick-text: AirPower is released and new AirPods are released

picks.text: Someone on Apple's executive website will leave or be fired
picks.full-pick-text: Someone on Apple's executive website will leave or be fired
picks.notes:
• The page as it existed at the time of the pick.
  • Above or below "the line", but in the end people from both sections did leave.

picks.text: Over-ear headphones (i.e. HeadPods)
picks.full-pick-text: Over-ear headphones (i.e. HeadPods)
picks.notes: • Myke was a year off, as AirPods Max came out at the end of 2020.

picks.text: Shortcuts 2.0 is showed off at WWDC with a new developer framework for apps
picks.full-pick-text: Shortcuts 2.0 is showed off at WWDC with a new developer framework for apps
picks.notes: • "Shortcuts also gets folders and AirPlay actions in 2019."

picks.text: WWDC will introduce a multi-year plan to move macOS and iOS closer
picks.full-pick-text: WWDC will introduce a multi-year plan to move macOS and iOS closer
picks.notes: • Mac Catalyst and SwiftUI deemed to fulfill this

picks.text: 2019 iPhones will start at a lower price than the 2018 iPhones
picks.full-pick-text: 2019 iPhones will start at a lower price than the 2018 iPhones

relevant-episodes.title: Connected #225: The Bear Will Charge You
Connected #243: I Win Money Because It's Green

picks.text: Apple will name a successor to Steve Dowling, former head of public relations at Apple
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will name a successor to Steve Dowling, former head of public relations at Apple
picks.notes:
• "Either named by Apple officially, or reported by more than one outlet that a person has been appointed."
  • Clearly in no hurry to do this, Apple finally hired Stella Low to the role in 2021.

picks.text: The 2020 iPhone line will feature at least one 5G phone
picks.full-pick-text: The 2020 iPhone line will feature at least one 5G phone
picks.notes:
• "Stephen is highly skeptical," Stephen jokingly predicts it will be called "iPhone 11S Pro Max 5G"
  • Before the prediction episode has even finished, news breaks that 5G service is coming to Stephen's own neighborhood.

picks.text: The 13 inch MacBook Pro will gain a larger screen
picks.full-pick-text: The 13 inch MacBook Pro will gain a larger screen
picks.notes: • The long-rumored 14" model finally came out in 2021.

picks.text: At least one of the 2020 iPhones will have a higher refresh rate display (Pro Motion)
picks.full-pick-text: At least one of the 2020 iPhones will have a higher refresh rate display (Pro Motion)
picks.notes: • This feature did show up in the iPhone 13 line.

picks.text: The iPad Pro line is updated before the iPhone with a hardware feature that's not on any current iPhone in 2019 or 2020
picks.full-pick-text: The iPad Pro line is updated before the iPhone with a hardware feature that's not on any current iPhone in 2019 or 2020
picks.notes: • Myke says during grading that he originally expected 5G to get him this point but LIDAR did instead, but he actually focused on LIDAR when originally explaining this pick. (During the grading, Federico delivers his impromptu review of the 2020 iPad Pro.)

picks.text: Apple will launch its own podcast content beyond its existing deal with Oprah
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will launch its own podcast content beyond its existing deal with Oprah

picks.text: Apple will release at least 1 new pro app for iPad that we haven't previously seen on iPad
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will release at least 1 new pro app for iPad that we haven't previously seen on iPad
picks.notes:
• "(The app can be universal.)"
  • After years of waiting, Final Cut Pro and Logic Pro come to iPad in 2023.

picks.text: The notch on the iPhone will get physically smaller in at least one of the 2020 iPhones
picks.full-pick-text: The notch on the iPhone will get physically smaller in at least one of the 2020 iPhones
picks.notes: • Grading for this was tricky, but Stephen discovered that the Apple Accessory Design Guidelines indicate that the notch got very slightly smaller, by millimeters, mostly due to the switch from LCD to OLED in the iPhone 12. The consensus is that it's a technical victory but not an honorable one.

picks.text: Apple Podcast app launches on Android
picks.full-pick-text: Apple Podcast app launches on Android

picks.text: Shortcuts will gain folders and/or new ways to run Shortcuts
picks.full-pick-text: Shortcuts will gain folders and/or new ways to run Shortcuts

picks.text: Apple will announce a new services bundle
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will announce a new services bundle

picks.text: WWDC brings no real changes to Mac Catalyst
picks.full-pick-text: WWDC brings no real changes to Mac Catalyst

picks.text: The iPad home screen will continue to change with new elements and additions
picks.full-pick-text: The iPad home screen will continue to change with new elements and additions
picks.notes: • The iPad went mostly unchanged in 2020, but iPadOS 15 did bring changes the next year.

picks.text: Apple will introduce a new iMac design with an accompanying external display
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will introduce a new iMac design with an accompanying external display
picks.notes: • The new iMac design wouldn't come out until 2021, and the new display came in 2022.

picks.text: Apple will not ship an ARM Mac in 2020
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will not ship an ARM Mac in 2020
picks.notes: • In 2019, Stephen picked the first ARM Mac to be shipped, so this was his... revenge?

picks.text: Apple announces a new Mac Pro powered by Apple Silicon
picks.full-pick-text: Apple announces a new Mac Pro powered by Apple Silicon

picks.text: The iPad mini does receive the new design language
picks.full-pick-text: The iPad mini does receive the new design language
picks.notes: • "Originally, Stephen said it would not receive it", but the other hosts criticized him for his negativity.

picks.text: Apple launches at least one iPad model with a new display technology
picks.full-pick-text: Apple launches at least one iPad model with a new display technology
picks.notes: • He initially picked mini LED specifically. And after further discussion it was agreed that this meant a new display technology for the iPad, so for example OLED would also count.

picks.text: iOS 15 gives users more home screen customization options
picks.full-pick-text: iOS 15 gives users more home screen customization options
picks.notes:
• Specifically not iPadOS 15.
  • This was granted but the customization options were not extensive, just turning on and off home screens, both manually and with focus modes.

picks.text: No in-person WWDC 2021
picks.full-pick-text: No in-person WWDC 2021

picks.text: Apple launches 'AirTags' accessories for tracking physical objects
picks.full-pick-text: Apple launches 'AirTags' accessories for tracking physical objects
picks.notes: • The name was allowed to be different, but Federico nailed it.

picks.text: A Mac gets a screen that supports touch and/or Apple Pencil input
picks.full-pick-text: A Mac gets a screen that supports touch and/or Apple Pencil input
picks.notes: • Myke was torn between this and "iPad multitasking is overhauled again", but elected to make the more passionate pick.

picks.text: Apple has Apple Silicon versions of all of its Intel Macs on sale by the end of 2021
picks.full-pick-text: Apple has Apple Silicon versions of all of its Intel Macs on sale by the end of 2021
picks.notes:
• "No Intel Macs are available for sale without an Apple Silicon counterpart." Myke points out the iMac Pro as a potential spoiler.
  • (For pick complexity purposes, I'm counting this as 1 condition for each Mac line that still had no Apple Silicon counterpart at the beginning of 2021: The larger MacBook Pros, the iMac in both sizes, the iMac Pro, and the Mac Pro. The Mac mini is 1 line with a high end and low end, so it already had an "Apple Silicon counterpart" although the high end Mac mini was still Intel.)
  • The iMac Pro left the lineup entirely, but the Mac Pro remained on Intel for about a year and a half more.

picks.text: Apple will release a new programming app for iPad
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will release a new programming app for iPad
picks.notes:
• Federico asks to be quoted as "very very positive" that he will win on the strength of this Ricky Pick.
  • Not Swift Playgrounds, that is not new. As it turns out, they added this functionality to Swift Playgrounds.
  • This was deemed not a reuse of a previous pick since it is even riskier and more specific.

picks.text: Another variant of over-ear headphones will be released
picks.full-pick-text: Another variant of over-ear headphones will be released
picks.notes: • Technically Apple wasn't specified, but of course that wasn't the intent.

picks.text: Apple releases a weather API
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases a weather API
picks.notes: • The revamped weather API was announced at WWDC in 2022.

picks.text: New Apple TV released
picks.full-pick-text: New Apple TV released

picks.text: iPad multitasking is overhauled again
picks.full-pick-text: iPad multitasking is overhauled again

picks.text: A new iMac has adjustability that is reminiscent of the Pro Display XDR
picks.full-pick-text: A new iMac has adjustability that is reminiscent of the Pro Display XDR

picks.text: Apple releases its own game controller
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases its own game controller

picks.text: iOS gets a native feature to change icons for any app you want
picks.full-pick-text: iOS gets a native feature to change icons for any app you want

picks.text: Apple releases a bigger iPad Pro
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases a bigger iPad Pro

picks.text: At least one new iPhone model has both Face ID and Touch ID
picks.full-pick-text: At least one new iPhone model has both Face ID and Touch ID

picks.text: WidgetKit will support new widget sizes and more interactivity
picks.full-pick-text: WidgetKit will support new widget sizes and more interactivity
picks.notes: • The boolean operator "and" ends up taking this pick down, as interactivity wouldn't come until 2023.

picks.text: Apple puts a cheaper display on sale as a sibling to the XDR
picks.full-pick-text: Apple puts a cheaper display on sale as a sibling to the XDR

picks.text: There will be a chip named M1 followed by a letter
picks.full-pick-text: There will be a chip named M1 followed by a letter

picks.text: The new iPhone will be the 12S, not the 13
picks.full-pick-text: The new iPhone will be the 12S, not the 13

picks.text: Apple ships an AR, VR, and/or MR dedicated device
picks.full-pick-text: Apple ships an AR, VR, and/or MR dedicated device

picks.text: No Mac gets a cellular data option
picks.full-pick-text: No Mac gets a cellular data option

picks.text: The iPod Touch will be cancelled
picks.full-pick-text: The iPod Touch will be cancelled
picks.notes:
• The other hosts question the word "cancelled" here.
  • Finally came true in 2022.

picks.text: The 11" iPad Pro gets a mini LED display
picks.full-pick-text: The 11" iPad Pro gets a mini LED display
picks.notes: • This was originally "WWDC 2022 will be virtual", but that was very close to last year's pick, which was within the 365 day limit. It was a borderline judgement, but ultimately they decided they didn't like the precedent.

picks.text: At least one AirPods model will support lossless music playback
picks.full-pick-text: At least one AirPods model will support lossless music playback

picks.text: Apple releases a new MacBook Air that comes with some colour options not previously available in this product line
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases a new MacBook Air that comes with some colour options not previously available in this product line
picks.notes:
• It got Midnight and Starlight.
  • This is the beginning of an increasingly musical accompaniment to Stephen's "correct" bell, to accommodate Zoom's echo cancellation.

picks.text: The iPad's external display support goes unchanged
picks.full-pick-text: The iPad's external display support goes unchanged
picks.notes:
• Was originally "By December 31, 2022, no Intel Macs will remain on sale as new machines", but this was also too close for comfort, although arguably the previous pick was more permissive than this would have been.
  • Stage Manager in fact brought major changes.

picks.text: The next generation Apple Watch will have some kind of body temperature sensor
picks.full-pick-text: The next generation Apple Watch will have some kind of body temperature sensor

picks.text: There will be no iPhone 14 with a 5.4" display
picks.full-pick-text: There will be no iPhone 14 with a 5.4" display
picks.notes:
• AKA the iPhone mini.
  • 😭

picks.text: Apple (of its own choice, not in direct response to a legal case) will allow developers to use payment methods outside the App Store
picks.full-pick-text: Apple (of its own choice, not in direct response to a legal case) will allow developers to use payment methods outside the App Store

picks.text: iOS 16 brings major changes for systemwide design customization
picks.full-pick-text: iOS 16 brings major changes for systemwide design customization
picks.notes:
• Also, "Apple will let users choose their own app icons, and they'll introduce new App Store categories for wallpaper and/or icon apps"
  • A reuse and double down of last year's Flexie.

picks.text: The new Mac Pro will be...
picks.full-pick-text: The new Mac Pro will be smaller, not a cube shape, feature no support for the current MPX modules and/or will allow for some form of expandability outside of Thunderbolt. It will be only be available in one color.
picks.notes:
• "... smaller, not a cube shape, feature no support for the current MPX modules and/or will allow for some form of expandability outside of Thunderbolt. It will be only be available in one color."
  • Another "and/or" added to a pick, which happened a few times this episode. It applies to just the MPX modules and expandability clause.

picks.text: Tim Cook says "metaverse"
picks.full-pick-text: Tim Cook says "metaverse"
picks.notes: • Correct, as reported at 9to5Mac.

picks.text: New AirPods Max
picks.full-pick-text: New AirPods Max
picks.notes: • Was originally "AirPods Max 2"

picks.text: A headset will not be unveiled at WWDC
picks.full-pick-text: A headset will not be unveiled at WWDC

picks.text: An iMac Pro is unveiled
picks.full-pick-text: An iMac Pro is unveiled

picks.text: iPadOS multitasking remains unchanged from iOS 15's implementation
picks.full-pick-text: iPadOS multitasking remains unchanged from iOS 15's implementation

picks.text: iOS 16 will bring a more "bottom-of-the-screen-centric" design to at least 1 additional app
picks.full-pick-text: iOS 16 will bring a more "bottom-of-the-screen-centric" design to at least 1 additional app
picks.notes: • Books as well as the Lock Screen were cited.

picks.text: Apple announces a new paid service
picks.full-pick-text: Apple announces a new paid service
picks.notes: • Apple's Major League Soccer deal qualifies.

picks.text: A new home-focused device is released
picks.full-pick-text: A new home-focused device is released

picks.text: Apple announces a developer kit for its headset
picks.full-pick-text: Apple announces a developer kit for its headset

picks.text: A more powerful Mac Mini is announced, but it is not a "Mac Mini Pro"
picks.full-pick-text: A more powerful Mac Mini is announced, but it is not a "Mac Mini Pro"
picks.notes:
• The Mac Studio is very close, but this pick was about the name and the Mac Studio, while very reminiscent of the Mini, is not named as such.
  • Just 2 weeks after the grading window closed, the M2 Pro Mac mini was announced.

picks.text: Apple stops using the iTunes Store app, and moves store content into dedicated apps
picks.full-pick-text: Apple stops using the iTunes Store app, and moves store content into dedicated apps

picks.text: Apple brings Mail extensions to iOS and iPadOS
picks.full-pick-text: Apple brings Mail extensions to iOS and iPadOS

picks.text: Apple Notes will borrow some features from the modern generation of note-taking apps
picks.full-pick-text: Apple Notes will borrow some features from the modern generation of note-taking apps, like wiki-style links, a quick switcher, or nested pages.
picks.notes: • "...like wiki-style links, a quick switcher, or nested pages."

picks.text: Some Mac-only Shortcuts actions will become available on iPhone and iPad
picks.full-pick-text: Some Mac-only Shortcuts actions will become available on iPhone and iPad

picks.text: There are new ways to turn off the alerts that Shortcuts displays constantly
picks.full-pick-text: There are new ways to turn off the alerts that Shortcuts displays constantly
picks.notes:
• "Either confirmation banners or the notification when running with automation."
  • This came with iOS 16, and the Dynamic Island changed some of these interactions as well.

picks.text: Podcasts will gain audio effects for enhanced sound and trim silence
picks.full-pick-text: Podcasts will gain audio effects for enhanced sound and trim silence
picks.notes: • Originally was Federico's Risky Pick.

picks.text: Apple adds more filters to smart folders in Notes
picks.full-pick-text: Apple adds more filters to smart folders in Notes

picks.text: Apple releases a larger MacBook Air
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases a larger MacBook Air

picks.text: Apple releases a new Mac mini
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases a new Mac mini
picks.notes: • Ungraded: Probably the same design but with an M2 chip. More Thunderbolt ports would be nice.

picks.text: WWDC 2023 follows the same format as WWDC 2022, with a small number of people invited in person
picks.full-pick-text: WWDC 2023 follows the same format as WWDC 2022, with a small number of people invited in person
picks.notes: • No convention center, no ticket lottery, just like in 2022.

picks.text: An iPhone gets USB-C
picks.full-pick-text: An iPhone gets USB-C
picks.notes:
• Seems inevitable but it might be a bit ahead of its time.
  • Ungraded: might just be the Pro phones, to advertise the improved transfer speeds.

picks.text: There will not be an iPhone 15 mini
picks.full-pick-text: There will not be an iPhone 15 mini

picks.text: No Intel Macs are left on sale (as new) at the end of 2023
picks.full-pick-text: No Intel Macs are left on sale (as new) at the end of 2023
picks.notes: • "Does not include the refurbished or educational stores." Or, in other words, the Intel Mac Minis and Mac Pro are not sold as new anymore (and of course they don't introduce a new Intel Mac).

picks.text: Apple shows off their headset in March, they announce developer tools at WWDC, then show it off again at an event in September. It ships to customers in October
picks.full-pick-text: Apple shows off their headset in March, they announce developer tools at WWDC, then show it off again at an event in September. It ships to customers in October

picks.text: Apple will release its biggest iPad ever with a display of at least 16 inches...
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will release its biggest iPad ever with a display of at least 16 inches. It won't be OLED, it'll have the front-facing camera on the landscape side, and two USB-C ports at least. It'll be called iPad Studio.
picks.notes: • "... It won't be OLED, it'll have the front-facing camera on the landscape side, and two USB-C ports at least. It'll be called iPad Studio."

picks.text: Apple releases an iPad Pro with a screen between 15.0 and 15.9999 inches which replaces the 11-inch model
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases an iPad Pro with a screen between 15.0 and 15.9999 inches which replaces the 11-inch model
picks.notes: • Was originally just "15 inch" but a specific range was requested after Federico's pick was read.

picks.text: There is no iPad bigger than 12.9 inches
picks.full-pick-text: There is no iPad bigger than 12.9 inches

picks.text: An iPhone gets a periscope camera
picks.full-pick-text: An iPhone gets a periscope camera

picks.text: Apple's headset has widgets that look similar to iOS
picks.full-pick-text: Apple's headset has widgets that look similar to iOS

picks.text: Apple releases an iMac with a larger screen
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases an iMac with a larger screen

picks.text: AirPods Max 2 feature a foldable design, and come with a new case that fully encloses them
picks.full-pick-text: AirPods Max 2 feature a foldable design, and come with a new case that fully encloses them

picks.text: The iPad mini gets updated, featuring either a mini LED or OLED screen
picks.full-pick-text: The iPad mini gets updated, featuring either a mini LED or OLED screen

picks.text: Apple will release a new monitor
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will release a new monitor
picks.notes: • Myke wanted an additional pick to match the 7 of the other hosts, so this was thrown in after the others had gone.

picks.text: The iPad mini will be updated
picks.full-pick-text: The iPad mini will be updated

picks.text: Apple Music Classical ships
picks.full-pick-text: Apple Music Classical ships
picks.notes: • Was originally written "Apple Music Classic", but Myke pointed out that it isn't called "classic music".

picks.text: Twitter will file for bankruptcy
picks.full-pick-text: Twitter will file for bankruptcy
picks.notes: • The first ever completely non-Apple related pick!

picks.text: The iPhone 15 and 15 Pro use the same generation system-on-a-chip
picks.full-pick-text: The iPhone 15 and 15 Pro use the same generation system-on-a-chip
picks.notes: • They could be different chips with different branding, but not, say, an A16 and an A15.

picks.text: Apple sells an "iPhone 15 Ultra"
picks.full-pick-text: Apple sells an "iPhone 15 Ultra"

picks.text: The Apple Silicon Mac Pro allows third-party GPUs to be used
picks.full-pick-text: The Apple Silicon Mac Pro allows third-party GPUs to be used

picks.text: The Mac Mini is updated to include more than one system-on-a-chip option
picks.full-pick-text: The Mac Mini is updated to include more than one system-on-a-chip option
picks.notes: • e.g. M2 and M2 Pro.

picks.text: There will be new ways to invoke Siri by voice instead of saying "Hey Siri"
picks.full-pick-text: There will be new ways to invoke Siri by voice instead of saying "Hey Siri"

picks.text: Apple will revive the HomePod line with new devices
picks.full-pick-text: Apple will revive the HomePod line with new devices
picks.notes: • New deviceS, plural. Must be at least 2 and must be new products, not product refreshes like a new HomePod mini.

picks.text: Second-generation AirPods Max will ship during the year
picks.full-pick-text: Second-generation AirPods Max will ship during the year
picks.notes: • Was originally "AirPods Max 2" specifically.

picks.text: There is no second generation Apple Watch Ultra this year
picks.full-pick-text: There is no second generation Apple Watch Ultra this year

picks.text: Apple brings new actions to Shortcuts to control windows on iPadOS
picks.full-pick-text: Apple brings new actions to Shortcuts to control windows on iPadOS

picks.text: Apple releases new developer APIs for Stage Manager
picks.full-pick-text: Apple releases new developer APIs for Stage Manager
picks.notes: • At the time of picking there were not any developer APIs for Stage Manager on either macOS or iPadOS, so anything will be "new".

picks.text: At least one Twitter app update will be rejected from the App Store
picks.full-pick-text: At least one Twitter app update will be rejected from the App Store
